edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api
Class Ref

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.Ref

public class Ref
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the name of a ref. The types of Refs, specified in the RefType enumeration, are:

  • BRANCH
  • HEAD
  • REMOTE
  • SHA1
  • TAG
If the RefType of a Ref instance is BRANCH, then the branch name is maintained by the instance. The branch name is simply a String representing the name of the branch. Examples:
  • master
  • testing
  • crazyidea
If the RefType of a Ref instance is HEAD, then a commit offset value is maintained as an int. This commit offset indicates the commit back from the HEAD commit on the branch checked out in the working tree. Values greater than or equal to zero are acceptable and correspond to:
  • 0 - The current HEAD commit
  • 1 - The commit prior to the current HEAD commit
  • 2 - The second commit prior to the current HEAD commit
  • etc...
If the RefType of a Ref instance is REMOTE, then the remote repository name and remote branch name are maintained as a Strings by the instance.

Note: It is possible for the remote repository name to be non-existent. In such cases, the repository value is null.

Examples:
  • remote repository name: origin, remote branch name: master
  • remote repository name: davidsrepo, remote branch name: testing
  • remote repository name: , remote branch name: crazyidea
If the RefType of a Ref instance is SHA1, then the SHA1 value is maintained as a String value. This string value can be:
  • the full SHA1
  • a SHA1 truncated to the first n characters
If the RefType of a Ref instance is TAG, then the name of the tag is maintained as a String value. Examples:
  • Release1.0.8
  • 6.3-RC1

Constructor Detail

Ref

public Ref()
Method Detail

createBranchRef

public static Ref createBranchRef(java.lang.String name)
Creates a Ref of type BRANCH.

Parameters:
name - The branch name of this ref. If the value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the value has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Returns:
A Ref instance of type BRANCH.

createHeadRef

public static Ref createHeadRef(int headOffset)
Creates a Ref of type HEAD.

Parameters:
headOffset - The offset of the commit back from the HEAD commit on the current working branch. If the value is less than zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Returns:
A Ref instance of type HEAD.

createRemoteRef

public static Ref createRemoteRef(java.lang.String repositoryName,
                                  java.lang.String name)
Creates a Ref of type REMOTE.

Parameters:
repositoryName - The remote repository name of this ref. If the value is blank or null, the value will be maintained as null.
name - The remote branch name of this ref. If the value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the value has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Returns:
A Ref instance of type REMOTE.

createSha1Ref

public static Ref createSha1Ref(java.lang.String name)
Creates a Ref of type SHA1.

Parameters:
name - The SHA1 name of this ref. The value can be a short name or the full SHA1 value. If the value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the value has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Returns:
A Ref instance of type SHA1.

createTagRef

public static Ref createTagRef(java.lang.String name)
Creates a Ref of type TAG.

Parameters:
name - The tag name of this ref. If the value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the value has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Returns:
A Ref instance of type TAG.

getRefType

public Ref.RefType getRefType()
Gets the type of the Ref instance.

Returns:
The type of the Ref instance.

getHeadOffset

public int getHeadOffset()
Gets the offset of the commit back from the HEAD commit on the current working branch for this Ref instance.

Returns:
If the type of this Ref is not HEAD, then -1 is returned. Otherwise, the offset of the commit back from the HEAD commit on the current working branch is returned.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Gets the name of this ref.

Returns:
If the type of this Ref is not BRANCH, REMOTE, SHA1 or TAG, then null is returned. Otherwise, the name of this ref is returned.

getRepositoryName

public java.lang.String getRepositoryName()
Gets the repository name of this ref.

Returns:
If the type of this Ref is not REMOTE, then null is returned. If the type of this Ref is REMOTE and there is no associated repository name, then null is returned. Otherwise, the repository name of this ref is returned.
